title: RP161: Improving farm practices in Mackay North Queensland

tasks.task: Joining the 161 project for alternative cane growing methods.
subtasks: Seeking different perspectives on farming methods from experts.
Collaborating with Shane on adjusting nitrogen levels in the field.
Examining soil samples to create a tailored nutrient program.
Adhering to the recommended fertiliser rates provided by the project.
Understanding the success of reducing nitrogen levels and its financial benefits.

tasks.task: Recommending the 161 project to fellow farmers.
subtasks: Sharing positive outcomes, such as improved crop yield and reduced costs.
Highlighting the ease of following the nutrient management plan.
Stressing the importance of expert opinions and reassurance in implementing new practices.

Joining a farming project for alternative methods. Then, they talk about Collaborating with Shane to make changes, like reducing nitrogen levels. So, that could be a subtask: SUBTASK: Working with experts to adjust fertiliser use.

SUBTASK: Adhering to recommended fertiliser application rates. Also, they note the convenience of having all the information on one sheet, so the plan needs no further research. A subtask would be: SUBTASK: Using a straightforward nutrient management plan provided by experts.

Observing improved crop yield through reduced nitrogen use. Financial benefits like saving 400 per year (I think they mentioned C, maybe dollars? Wait, need to confirm) are mentioned, so that's a subtask under economical aspects: SUBTASK: Achieving cost savings through optimized nutrient use.

tasks.task: Recommending the project to other farmers. Subtasks here could be talking about the positive outcomes they've experienced and advising others to try it themselves.

tasks.task: **MAINTASK**: Joining the 161 project for alternative cane growing methods.
subtasks: Seeking different perspectives on farming methods from experts (e.g., Shane).
Collaborating with experts (e.g., Shane and John) to adjust nutrient management practices.
Examining soil samples to create a tailored nutrient program.
Adhering to the recommended fertiliser rates provided by the project (e.g., nitrogen level reduction).
Understanding the financial benefits and improved crop yield from reduced nitrogen use.

tasks.task: Recommending the 161 project to other farmers.
subtasks: Sharing positive outcomes and cost savings from optimized nutrient use.
Highlighting the ease and straightforwardness of following the nutrient management plan.
